ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral Sensorineural Hearing Loss (Cochlear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Indicated by absent air-bone gaps, normal tympanometry, diminished speech scores, low sensation level acoustic reflexes (recruitment), absent OAEs, and steep ABR latency-intensity function.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Unknown Etiology (Possibly Congenital)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports hearing difficulty as long as she can remember. Lack of known family history does not rule out recessive hereditary causes or early acquired disease.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine type and degree of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To evaluate reflex pathways and check for recruitment or retrocochlear signs.
To differentiate cochlear from retrocochlear site of lesion.
To assess outer hair cell function.
To screen for auditory fatigue characteristic of retrocochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Results indicate a bilateral, symmetrical, sloping mild-to-moderately-severe sensorineural hearing loss. Ancillary testing (low sensation level reflexes, steep ABR latency-intensity function, absent OAEs, negative tone decay) supports a cochlear site of lesion.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral symmetrical sloping SNHL. Thresholds range from 30 dB HL at 250 Hz to 60-70 dB HL at high frequencies.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT Right 45 dB HL, Left 40 dB HL. SRS Right 86%, Left 82%.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A. Static compliance Right 0.80 cc, Left 0.78 cc.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Present at 90-95 dB HL bilaterally (low sensation levels), consistent with recruitment.

tests.name: ABR
tests.result_summary: All waves prolonged; normal interpeak latencies; steep latency-intensity function.

tests.name: Tone decay test at 4000 Hz
tests.result_summary: Right: 10 dB decay in 60s; Left: 15 dB decay in 60s (Minimal/Negative).

proposed_items: Hearing aid fitting and adjustment period
Auditory rehabilitation and hearing aid orientation
Medical consultation (for clearance, etiology, and blood studies)
counseling_actions: Discuss the nature of the hearing loss (sensorineural, likely cochlear)
Provide a positive yet realistic appraisal of potential for hearing aid use
Discuss the possibility of medical consultation regarding irreversibility and etiology
Inquire about interest in genetic counseling

escalation.rationale_short: For medical clearance prior to hearing aids, investigation of etiology (blood studies), and potential genetic counseling referral.

follow_up_plan.objective: Reevaluation of hearing thresholds if not proceeding with rehabilitation immediately.
